title: Dwarka is an Ancient City
text:
Dwarka is an Ancient City Dwarka is an Ancient City 0 
Among the seven holiest cities of India, Saptapuri Dwarka--also called Suvarna Dw@rka (Golden Dwark@)--is situated on the side of the Kutch Peninsula, facing the Arabian Sea, in Jamnagar, Gujarat. A renowned pilgrimage destination, Dw@rka, formerly called the Gateway to Western India, was an important sea port. 
DwarKa is an ancient city. It absolutely was built about 5,000 years ago by non other than Lord Vishwakarma. No wonder, the area finds mention within the Mahabharata, the Bhagavad-Gita, while the Skandpurana. The present city of Dwark@ could be the seventh city, as DwarK@ was destroyed and rebuilt six times before. 
It was at Dwark@ that Lord Krishna built his new capital after he left Mathura. He stayed at DwarkA for about 100 years before he left the town for Khushali after facing continued harassment from Jarasandha--the father-in-law of Kansa whom the Lord had killed earlier. 
The sacred host to DwarK@ happens to be attracting visitors since long. Many renowned personalities that include, and others, Adi Shankaracharya, Ramanuja, Narsimh Mehta, Mirabai, Kabir and Nanak had visited the spot at some point or perhaps the other. These well-known people, by their blessed presence, added much value to the already sacred host to Dwark@ that even now continues to attract visitors from all components of India as well as abroad. 
Attractions 
Dwark@ Dheesh Temple: The pride of Dwark@ is the wonderful DwarkA Dheesh Temple, also called the Jagat Temple. The beautiful temple has five storeys and it is thought to have already been built by Sambha, the grandson of Lord Krishna. The Dwark@ Dheesh Temple has two imposing gates--Swarga Dwar and Moksha Dwar. The Swarga Dwar is used for the entry purposes in addition to Moksha Dw@r is used for the exit purposes by the pilgrims. 
Other key temples at Dwarka are Trikamji Temple, Kalyanrai Temple, Patrani Temple, and Durvas Temple. 
Dwark@ Peetha: Dwark@ Peetha--also called Sharada Peetha--is one of several four dhams (shrines) of India founded by Adi Shankaracharya, the others being Sringeri, Puri and Jyotimath. 
Nageshwar Jyotirlinga: Nageshwar Jyotirlinga at Dwark@ is one of the 12 holy shrines of Lord Shiva. 
Bet Dwark@: Bet Dwark@ is another attraction of Dwark@. Here, Harappan and Roman antiquities have been discovered. Besides, it is the place where Lord Vishnu had killed the Demon Shankharsura.
